page.title: 03Employment in Bwlchysarnau
page.content: The major form of employment is farming with 12 of the households in the area being family farms or associated dwellings. Only 1 person is actually employed as a farmworker, most farms making do with family help. Three people are self employed, a builder, an agricultural contractor and a garage owner, who also employs a mechanic / bus driver. One person works in the Forestry Commission, six housholds consist of retired persons and the remainder travel to employment in the surrounding towns ranging from factory work to Local Authority employment. The distance travelled each day is a problem in finding a job as are the weather conditions in winter. At the moment there is no unemployment problem, although several of the schoolleavers are on YTS schemes.
